b037dacc-d7cd-4966-a110-f49f51be51ee.description: Earners of the Experiential Learning badge can apply STEM theory in a real-world context. Earners can reflect on the knowledge, skills, competencies and perspectives they have developed while participating in STEM Undergraduate Research and STEM Co-Curricular Learning activities outside the classroom, including service to science-focused organizations such as New York City Department of Parks and Recreation, Newtown Creek Alliance and HarborLab, and STEM research with faculty.
b037dacc-d7cd-4966-a110-f49f51be51ee.name: Experiential Learning, STEM Co-Curricular Learning

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in one approved off-campus STEM experiential learning event
Submit written responses to specific reflection prompts, evaluated and approved by faculty members involved in the project

75e21c2e-c225-46ab-b9cc-15b4a96f93b3.description: The earner of the Oral/Written Communications badge can articulate thoughts and ideas clearly and effectively in written and oral forms to person inside and outside the organization. The individual has public speaking skills and can write and edit memos and letters and successfully express their ideas to others.
75e21c2e-c225-46ab-b9cc-15b4a96f93b3.name: Oral/Written Communication

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate oral and written communication skills

8fe4dc5f-b748-42d7-b7c1-94ecee32a6bd.description: Earners of the LAGCC Humanitarian Initiative can create a platform for students, faculty, and staff to translate classroom and lived experiences to develop and execute global outreach projects on issues related to human rights and civic engagement.
8fe4dc5f-b748-42d7-b7c1-94ecee32a6bd.name: LAGCC Humanitarian Initiative

badge_template_activities.title: Commit to be engaged in LAGCC Humanitarian Initiative Projects for at least one semester.

Participate in an experiential learning opportunity that will enrich classroom learning experience and connect it to real world. Develop and execute global outreach projects related to human rights and civic engagement.
Present global outreach project during the end of the semester LaGCC Humanitarian Initiative Event.

Participate in a bi-annual events (Student Club Fairs, Career Fairs, and New Student Orientations) through tabling info sessions and engaging with the college community on global outreach projects. Build networking skills and develop social and professional relationships. Submit testimony on how the event helped with professional development.
A rubic will be used to grade student's work. An internal evaluation will be conducted by the LAGCC Humanitarian Initiative.

2820ecc6-68d1-4f9a-a85d-08dbf0fa7098.description: The earner of the Professionalism/Work Ethic badge has demonstrated personal accountability and effective work habits, such as punctuality, working productively with others, and time workload management. The earner understands the impact of non-verbal communication on professional work image. This individual demonstrates integrity and ethical behavior, acts responsibly with the interests of the larger community in mind, and is able to learn from their mistakes.
2820ecc6-68d1-4f9a-a85d-08dbf0fa7098.name: Professional Ethics (Professionalism and Work Ethics)

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate professionalism and ethical behavior

108e24cf-854f-465a-addb-ac25cdae7262.description: The earner of the Leadership badge has demonstrated proficient organizational skills, ability to communicate effectively, and empathy. The individual can guide, motivate, and achieve organization goals by delegating tasks with colleagues.
108e24cf-854f-465a-addb-ac25cdae7262.name: Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate leadership skills

c05bdb02-624e-4649-87ed-b25c9780e267.description: The earner of the Critical Thinking/Problem Solving badge can use reasoning and assessment strategies to analyze inquiries, make decisions and overcome problems. The individual is able to obtain, interpret, and use knowledge, facts, and data to reflect and draw conclusions.
c05bdb02-624e-4649-87ed-b25c9780e267.name: Critical Thinking (Problem Solving)

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate critical thinking and problem solving skills

3d78ddb6-1125-4a4c-8699-718ca03126a3.description: The earner of the Career Readiness badge can identify and articulate one’s skills, strengths, knowledge, and experiences relevant to the position desired and career goals, and identify areas necessary for professional growth. The individual can navigate and explore options, understand and can take the steps necessary to pursue opportunities, and understand how to self-advocate for opportunities in the workplace.
3d78ddb6-1125-4a4c-8699-718ca03126a3.name: Career Readiness Meta Badging Program

badge_template_activities.title: Earn 3 badges from the Career Readiness Meta Badging Program

492831aa-c04c-476b-b3ac-adce3f0ccb5c.description: The earner of the Teamwork/Collaboration badge can build collaborative relationships with colleagues and customers representing diverse cultures, races, ages, genders, religions, lifestyles, and viewpoints. The individual is able to incorporate knowledge and ideas and successfully integrate within a team structure to complete any given task.
492831aa-c04c-476b-b3ac-adce3f0ccb5c.name: Collaboration (Teamwork)

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate teamwork and collaboration skills

fb8bd4eb-1f14-413d-8e76-f832ca6da3aa.description: Scholar’s ePortfolios are exemplary students who have gone above and beyond and revised their entire ePortfolio. Students can showcase how much they have grown as students and reflect upon their assignments, who they are, their future aspirations such as further advancing their education and professional goals. Students know how to develop a more professional ePortfolio, which they can use for obtaining a scholarship, employment, or to simply showcase their achievements.
fb8bd4eb-1f14-413d-8e76-f832ca6da3aa.name: ePortfolio Scholar

badge_template_activities.title: Attend 7 out of 8 workshop sessions
Redesign the aesthetics of the ePortfolio (banner and CSS coding) and revise and orgnaize their ePortfolio content

Reflect on past experiences, such as writing reflections for their courses, assignments, showcasing their best work, as well as writing about themselves (such as their biography and goals). Submit a written ePortfolio Scholars final refelction about their experience of the program, emphasizing their ePortfolio development process.

b2ad051a-df72-4f4d-a269-7a1b61eccaeb.description: The earner of the Digital Technology badge has demonstrated versatile skills using various digital platforms to effectively complete tasks and solve problems. The individual demonstrates effective adaptability to new and emerging technologies.
b2ad051a-df72-4f4d-a269-7a1b61eccaeb.name: Technology (Digital Technology)

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate ability to use various digital platforms and adapt to emerging technologies

2a48c8f5-2512-49ed-842e-2e7a4aaca213.description: The earner of the ASAP Scholar Badge is a motivated ASAP student at LaGuardia Community College who enrolled in ASAP Scholars Block courses. The student understands the value of life-long learning, honors academic excellence, and demonstrates civic participation and professional development. Individuals have participated in at least one experiential learning opportunity, can create and present an academic project, and can use networking skills to foster social and professional relationships.
2a48c8f5-2512-49ed-842e-2e7a4aaca213.name: ASAP SCHOLARS

badge_template_activities.title: Earn a B or higher in an ASAP Block course

OPTION 1: Create an academic project illustrating how the experiential learning component has enriched their classroom learning experience and reflecting on how the experience connects to real life application, OR
OPTION 2: Create and present an academic project at a research conference, group advisement, or via Live Stream session
Participate in the ASAP Scholars’ Community Partner Fair and engage with various organizations and programs

7b3588ca-61d1-429d-af06-88f68ad7e7c4.description: The earner of the Experiential Learning badge can assess textbooks, identifying features and content that helps them learn, in order to recognize textbook features that make learning easier and articulate and privilege those features. The earner can apply theory in a real-world context and advocate for the type of learning material best suited to their personal learning style.
7b3588ca-61d1-429d-af06-88f68ad7e7c4.name: Experiential Learning Badge

badge_template_activities.title: Attend training sessions to learn how to identify pedagogical aids in math and science textbooks. Develop skills in problem solving, research and analysis.
Use quantitative and qualitative survey tools to evaluate sample chapters from math and science textbooks. Integrate and apply knowledge and skills to new settings and complex problems.
Use a rubric to write final summative reviews for textbooks that were reviewed. Demonstrate knowledge and skills through written and oral communication to both internal and external audiences.

Inform community college students and faculty about the benefits and weaknesses of OER textbooks. Demonstrate civic knowledge and engagement through involvement with diverse communities and real-world challenges.

979e066d-49c7-4b39-9cff-2b41f186271c.description: The earner of this badge has completed the President’s Society program. This student has participated in full, has experience in Networking, Interviewing, Public Speaking, Etiquette and has attended NYC Cultural events.
979e066d-49c7-4b39-9cff-2b41f186271c.name: President's Society Ambassador

badge_template_activities.title: Attend PS workshops with less than 3 absences
Provide Community Service on Student Giving Day
Submit at least 5 thank you notes to PS Speakers timely enough to be included in group email

Write a reflection about your PS experience sent to Elyse Newman before June 30th, 2016, intended for your ePortfolio page. This may be based upon the material that you use to create your culminating assignment on Public Speaking.

f5e61595-0cac-4c3c-b165-a800d39b742a.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated an ability to direct, manage, or guide peers through a co-curricular task, activity or project, or they have demonstrated how they have deepened their knowledge and experience with using effective leadership techniques, models, and theories.
f5e61595-0cac-4c3c-b165-a800d39b742a.name: Leadership Entry Level

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in Emerging Leaders Program

d824acad-90f9-4a17-b42a-208345ec6ed7.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated an ability to direct, manage, or guide peers through a co-curricular task, activity or project, or they have demonstrated how they have deepened their knowledge and experience with using effective leadership techniques, models, and theories.
d824acad-90f9-4a17-b42a-208345ec6ed7.name: Leadership Mid-Level

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in My First Day Leader Training program, SGA Peer Tutor program, Crear Futuros Peer Mentor, BMEC Peer Mentor, First-time Club officer, Special Committees of Phi Theta Kappa

27abc3d3-3114-41c0-a86e-96233472646f.description: This badge will validate Phi Theta Kappa, Alpha Theta Phi chapter alumni organization members, enabling networking, leadership development, and mentoring current LaGuardia Community College students. Badges will help incentivize alumni involvement, encouraging communication, and help identify alumni online who are interested in reconnecting with the College.
27abc3d3-3114-41c0-a86e-96233472646f.name: Alpha Theta Phi Alumni Chapter Badge

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners should be graduates of LaGuardia Community College and a joint member of the LaGuardia Alumni Association and Alpha Theta Phi Alumni Association (ATPA). ATPA will serve as a volunteer board to engage current students and alumni through meaningful connections.

4143f72d-a52d-485e-998f-809682c9b70a.description: This badge will validate Phi Theta Kappa, Alpha Theta Phi chapter members, who are currently LaGuardia students. This will enabling networking, leadership development, and peer mentoring. Badges will help incentivize student involvement, encouraging communication, and help identify active members.
4143f72d-a52d-485e-998f-809682c9b70a.name: Alpha Theta Phi Chapter Badge

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners should be students of LaGuardia Community College and a member of the LaGuardia Alpha Theta Phi chapter of PTK.

591bc074-c216-45bb-b337-d51df40a7c5a.description: Earners of the Badging 101 badge are familiar with the badging projects currently available to LaGuardia students, understand how badging serves as a validated symbol of success and accomplishment for students to share with potential employers and four-year colleges, and know how badging is aligned to LaGuardia’s Core Competencies and Abilities.
591bc074-c216-45bb-b337-d51df40a7c5a.name: Badging 101 Badge

badge_template_activities.title: Learn about current badging projects at LaGuardia and how they align to the Core Competencies and Abilities
Learn about the process to create a Credly account and claim a badge

62d6a705-63ab-44b5-bd12-96f662969ee2.description: The earner of the LAGCC Data Analytics badge is able to gather, prepare, analyze and display data in meaningful ways using SQL, Python and Tableau. The earner has the capacity to perform intermediate data analytics in a variety of roles/functions across different industries.
62d6a705-63ab-44b5-bd12-96f662969ee2.name: Data Analytics

badge_template_activities.title: Insert criteria

19fe0ae5-e904-4d21-b3d2-9376a61f1c23.description: Earners of the Experiential Learning: Occupational Therapy Assistant (OTA) Service-Learning badge have developed and strengthened their OTA identity, and they can apply their learning in a real-world context.
19fe0ae5-e904-4d21-b3d2-9376a61f1c23.name: Experiential Learning Badge, Advocacy

badge_template_activities.title: Analyze organizational needs and application of OTA practice. Integrate and apply course content knowledge and skills to advocacy project.

Create a presentation based on needs assessment reflective of the community-based organization and its clients, and present to class and community-based organization. Demonstrate knowledge and skills through written and oral communication to both internal and external audiences.
Provide community service to a community-based organization. Demonstrate civic knowledge and engagement through involvement with diverse communities and real-world challenges.
Participate in group project. Develop and strengthen identity as an OTA professional.

278b8ae7-1de1-475c-a8f4-3ed306e61388.description: CHWs are important for communities & healthcare organizations, connecting individuals & families to needed services and information. The CHW badge holder demonstrates successful completion of the CHW program encompassing a comprehensive base of CHW knowledge. CHWs complete 3 courses: Foundations for CHWs with lecture & lab, Health & Wellness, outlines basic chronic illnesses & Community Public Health frameworks navigational tools to healthcare resources. CHWs complete an internship.
278b8ae7-1de1-475c-a8f4-3ed306e61388.name: LAGCC Community Health Worker (CHW)

badge_template_activities.title: RATIONALE: Badging this program demonstrates to workforce decision-makers that students who have earned the LAGCC Community Health Worker badge qualify for employment as Community Health Workers or as trained professionals in the myriad of titles in healthcare with similar roles.
EXAMPLES INCLUDE: Outreach Services Associate, Outreach Worker, Community Outreach Worker, Street Outreach Worker, Patient Navigator.

The Community Health Worker Certificate Training Program is a contextualized program that provides instruction and activities to build academic skills while preparing students to enter or advance in the workplace as a CHW. They receive extensive career development services and upon program completion earn a certificate of completion from LaGuardia and the LAGCC CHW badge.

GOAL 1: LAGCC CHWs learn to identify the 8 nationally recognized CHW core competencies, understand the roles and responsibilities of a CHW and learn to communicate effec-tively with community members regarding healthcare needs.
GOAL 2: LAGCC CHWs learn to search and catalogue community healthcare resources and to categorize the access pathway to health benefits in NYC.
GOAL 3: LAGCC CHWs develop a theoretical and practical overview of public health with a strong em-phasis in social justice and the role of policy in health outcomes.
GOAL 4: LAGCC CHWs learn to classify the basic and most com-mon chronic diseases.

3d896327-5640-4443-b4b5-b8abb3086624.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated an ability to direct, manage, or guide peers through a co-curricular task, activity or project, or they have demonstrated how they have deepened their knowledge and experience with using effective leadership techniques, models, and theories.
3d896327-5640-4443-b4b5-b8abb3086624.name: Leadership Advanced Level

badge_template_activities.title: Member of Student Government Association (Governors only), Student Senators, Phi Theta Kappa Executive Board, Student Activity Council Executive Board

3e1ed227-4742-44c2-9f0e-eb103f78b166.description: Students who receive a STEM service learning badge are active community members who have participated in at least two service learning events during the Spring 2016 semester. Students can successfully describe the significance of their service learning experience in terms of what they did, what they learned, and how the event related to their course work, their lives, and their community at large.
3e1ed227-4742-44c2-9f0e-eb103f78b166.name: Service Learning

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in at least two of four STEM-related community service events over the course of the Spring 2016 semester.
Write a short essay reflecting on their experience. The essay is evaluated and approved by faculty members involved in the project.
